questions.question: What's your ideal park dining style?

knowledgeCard.title: Dining at Disney & Universal
knowledgeCard.content: Quick Service (counter order, $10-18/meal) is fast and surprisingly good â€” try the Flame Tree BBQ at Animal Kingdom or Docking Bay 7 in Galaxy's Edge! Table Service ($25-60/person) is sit-down with a waiter â€” Sci-Fi Dine-In at Hollywood Studios is like eating in a drive-in movie theater! Signature Dining ($60-100+) includes places like Be Our Guest (inside Beast's Castle!) and Mythos at Universal (voted best theme park restaurant). Many families mix all three!

questions.question: How about Character Dining? (Eat with Disney characters!)

knowledgeCard.title: Character Dining Explained
knowledgeCard.content: Character meals are restaurants where Disney characters walk around to your table for photos and autographs while you eat! Popular ones: Chef Mickey's (Mickey & friends, breakfast/dinner), Cinderella's Royal Table (inside the castle!), 'Ohana (Lilo & Stitch breakfast at Polynesian Resort), Tusker House (Donald's Safari Breakfast). They cost $35-60/person but include amazing food AND the character experience. They book up 60 days out, so let Ben & Marie know soon if you want one!

knowledgeCard.title: Disney Handles Dietary Needs Like Champs
knowledgeCard.content: Disney is incredibly accommodating with dietary needs! Every quick-service and table-service location can handle allergies â€” just tell the cast member. Many menus are already labeled with allergy info. Vegan options have exploded recently (the Ronto Wrap in Galaxy's Edge is amazing!). Kosher, halal, and gluten-free options are available park-wide. If you have severe allergies, Disney chefs will personally come out to discuss your meal. Universal is similarly accommodating.

questions.question: Which food experiences sound amazing to you?

knowledgeCard.title: Iconic Park Foods You'll See Everywhere
knowledgeCard.content: Turkey legs at Magic Kingdom are a legendary photo op (and genuinely delicious). Dole Whip (pineapple soft serve at Aloha Isle) is addictive. School Bread at Norway in EPCOT is a hidden gem. Butterbeer at Wizarding World comes in frozen, cold, and hot versions! At EPCOT's World Showcase, you can literally eat your way around the world â€” fish & chips in the UK, crepes in France, sushi in Japan. The EPCOT Food & Wine Festival (fall) is peak foodie energy.

questions.question: What's your comfortable daily food budget per person?

knowledgeCard.title: Realistic Food Budget Guide
knowledgeCard.content: Budget-friendly ($40-60/day): Quick service meals + snacks. Bring refillable water bottles! Moderate ($60-90/day): 1 quick service, 1 table service, plus snacks and treats. Splurge ($90-150/day): Table service meals, signature dining, all the specialty snacks you want. Money-saving tip: Pack breakfast from the grocery store, eat a big lunch (lunch menus are cheaper than dinner!), and snack in the evening. Also, kids' meals at quick service are an amazing deal!
